bibl.title: Thomas S. Brown and et al v. Thomas Jefferson Hamilton. Petition for Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF THOMAS S. BROWN ET AL. FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS ETC.

Upon reading the petition of Junius Rochester who petitions upon the behalf and as the agent of Thomas S. Brown, G. Geods George Downing Charles Schubard Carl John Matson known as C.J. Young and Peter J. Wegner praying for a Writ of Habeas Corpus for the reasons and causes named therein and complained therein and the court being fully advised in the premises and the petitioner ever praying now it is ordered that the said Writ of Habeas Corpus issue directed to T.J. Hamilton Marshal of Washington Territory commanding him to produce the bodies of Thomas S. Brown, G. Geods George Downing Charles Schubard Carl John Matson (known as C.J. Young) and Peter J. Wegner before me at the District Court Room in the city of Seattle W.T. at the hour of 2 o'clock in the afternoon of the 17th day of October A.D. 1887. That then and there I may enquire in the causes complained of and say if the said petioners are so illegaly restrained as complained, and that I may do and direct as proper in the premises, and the clerk of the herein named court is ordered to issue the herein named writ. Done at Seattle W.T. October 15th 1887.

no 5367
In the matter of the application of Thomas S Brown et al for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
